heading: Is Stuffing gluten free?
intro: This public analysis report explains the biggest gluten risks in Stuffing and how to order more safely.

verdict.summary: Stuffing often contains bread, which is a significant source of gluten. Additionally, some seasonings and broths may contain gluten, so careful ingredient selection is crucial.

disclaimer: This guidance is informational only. Always verify ingredients and preparation with the restaurant.

sections.title: Quick answer
sections.body: Stuffing can vary by recipe, ingredients, and cross-contact controls in the kitchen.

sections.title: Common gluten risks
sections.body: Watch for hidden sources like soy sauce, malt flavoring, marinades, thickeners, and shared fryers.

sections.title: How BiteRight helps

safe: Gluten-free bread cubes (such as Udi's or Canyon Bakehouse)
Herbs and spices (fresh or labeled gluten-free)
Rice or quinoa as a base instead of bread
Gluten-free stuffing mixes (like Bob's Red Mill or Trader Joe's)

faq.question: Can BiteRight confirm if Stuffing is gluten free?
faq.answer: BiteRight highlights likely gluten risks based on ingredients and preparation. Always confirm with the kitchen if you have coeliac disease.

faq.question: What should I ask a restaurant?
faq.answer: Ask about shared equipment, sauces, marinades, and whether the kitchen has a dedicated gluten-free prep area.
